name: Making Love in the Sixteenth Century
description: In this course, students will follow the changing constructions of love and love poetry in the sixteenth century, starting with Wyatt and Surrey, passing through Tottel, to the Elizabethan court, and ending with the erotic love poetry that served as a backlash against the Petrarchanism of the early sixteenth century. [36L]
prerequisites: 1.0 credit in ENG and 3.0 additional credits.
